user_query: viral food poisoning from pesticides ?
text-davinci-003_response:
Viral food poisoning due to pesticides is an extremely serious condition that is incredibly rare, yet still possible. This type of poisoning occurs when a food item has been contaminated with pesticides that contain viruses. While viral food poisoning can occur from any type of contaminated food, eating food that has been exposed to pesticides is the most likely cause.
The most common virus responsible for pesticide-related food poisoning is Norovirus. This virus is highly contagious and can be spread through food and water that has been contaminated with pesticides. Symptoms of Norovirus include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fever, abdominal pain, and dehydration. In severe cases, the virus can cause more serious complications, such as hepatitis and cholecystitis.
When it comes to prevention, it is important to wash all fruits and vegetables carefully before consumption. Avoid eating food that has been exposed to pesticides, and use proper food handling techniques to prevent cross-contamination. Additionally, be aware of food recalls that can indicate contaminated foods. If you believe you may have been exposed to contaminated food, contact your doctor immediately.

user_query: does caffeine impair endothelial function in our arteries ?
text-davinci-003_response: Yes, caffeine does impair endothelial function in our arteries. Endothelial dysfunction is a process in which the inner lining of blood vessels becomes damaged or weakened. This means that the vessels lose their ability to produce nitric oxide, a molecule that helps to relax and expand the blood vessels, reducing blood pressure and reducing the risk of cardiovascular disease. Studies have shown that consuming super-high doses of caffeine (at least 8 cups of coffee) can impair the function of endothelial cells and reduce nitric oxide production, increasing blood pressures and making the heart work harder. However, long-term moderate doses of caffeine (2-3 cups a day) have been shown to be safe for most people with no significant impairment of endothelial function.

user_query: what about the oxalic acid in beets ?

Oxalic acid is a naturally occurring compound found in many plants, including beets. It is a colorless crystalline solid that has been used for a variety of purposes, including cleaning and bleaching products, and as a food preservative. In beets, it is primarily found in the form of oxalates, which are ionic compounds with a carboxyl group attached to two hydroxyl groups forming an organic acid. 
Oxalic acid serves many important functions for beets. It helps the plant store calcium and other mineral salts and helps protect the plant from disease. It also contributes to the beets' characteristic bitter taste. 
Small quantities of oxalic acid are not considered to be a health concern for humans. It is not easily absorbed in the small intestine and excess amounts are typically excreted in the urine. In cases where large amounts are consumed, oxalic acid can form crystals in the urinary tract. Eating beets regularly is not considered to be a risk factor for this condition. 
In conclusion, oxalic acid is a naturally present compound in beets with several beneficial functions. It is not considered to be a health risk unless large amounts are consumed, but eating beets regularly is not linked to any health concerns related to oxalic acid.

user_query: sulfite sensitivity from sulphur dioxide in dried fruits ?
text-davinci-003_response:
Sulphur dioxide (SO2) is one of the most commonly used food additives, primarily to preserve food, such as dried fruits, by preventing oxidation and microbial spoilage. It is also used as a preservative in wine and beer. People can become sensitive to sulphur dioxide in food, which can result in a range of symptoms. This condition is known as sulfite sensitivity, and it occurs when a person has an adverse response to the chemical, which can range from mild to severe.
The symptoms of sulfite sensitivity can vary, but the most common ones include swelling of the airways, sneezing, coughing, wheezing, chest tightness, and difficulty breathing. People with sulfite sensitivity may also experience nausea, abdominal pain, diarrhea, headache, and skin rash. In severe cases, a person can suffer anaphylactic shock or have life-threatening asthma attacks.

Achieving a good Omega 3 to Omega 6 fatty acid ratio is an important aspect of a healthy diet. It is possible to achieve this through several different methods, such as dietary changes, supplements and lifestyle changes.

3. Lifestyle Changes: Making lifestyle choices that reduce inflammation, such as getting adequate sleep, reducing stress, and exercising regularly are important for achieving a healthy omega 3 to 6 ratio. 
In summary, the best way to achieve a good omega 3 to omega 6 fatty acid ratio is by eating a diet rich in omega-3 fatty acids, reducing the intake of processed foods that contain excessive amounts of omega-6 fatty acids, supplementing the diet with omega-3 fatty acids, and making lifestyle choices that reduce inflammation.

user_query: how long to avoid fish before conception ?

Fish lower in mercury, such as light tuna, salmon, catfish, and shrimp, can be consumed in moderation, as long as they are from inspected sources, but it is still wise for women to lower their exposure to mercury in general prior to conception. As such, it is generally recommended to limit eating fish and other seafood to 2 or 3 servings a week at most (or about 8 to 12 ounces per week).

user_query: does animal protein cause osteoporosis ?
text-davinci-003_response: Animal protein does not directly cause osteoporosis, however it may be a contributing factor. Animal protein affects calcium balance in the body, primarily through effects on acid-base balance. High levels of animal protein consumption tend to increase the production of acid in the body, which then requires the body to use up more of its calcium stores in an attempt to restore acid-base balance. This decrease in calcium stores can lead to osteoporosis over time. Aside from this effect on calcium balance, some studies have found that animal proteins may increase the risk of osteoporosis directly, while vegetarian diets may actually be beneficial for the prevention of the condition. Therefore, while animal protein does not directly cause osteoporosis, its consumption may contribute to the condition over time.

user_query: which parts of the mediterranean diet extended life ?
text-davinci-003_response:
The Mediterranean Diet is based on the traditional eating habits in the countries of this region, such as Greece, Italy, and Spain. Its main components include a high intake of vegetables, fruits, nuts, legumes, whole grains, and olive oil. Additionally, the diet includes moderate intake of fish, eggs, and dairy, while limiting red meat. Studies have shown that adhering to this diet can help reduce the risk of developing cardiovascular disease, lower cholesterol levels, and reduce inflammation. It can also help extend life by reducing the risk of death from any cause. Studies have found that the following elements of the Mediterranean diet are linked to a longer life expectancy in those who follow it:
1. A high intake of fruits and vegetables. Eating a balanced diet that includes plenty of fresh fruits and vegetables can help reduce the risk of developing chronic illnesses that can lead to an early death, such as heart disease or cancer.
2. Low intake of red and processed meat. Regularly consuming red and processed meats can increase the risk of developing chronic illnesses. Eating less of these meats can help reduce the risk and extend life.
3. Eating healthy fats. Consuming sources of healthy fats such as olive oil, nuts, and seeds is associated with lower rates of death from any cause.
4. Limiting sugar and refined carbohydrates. Refined carbohydrates, such as white bread and pastries, can contribute to weight gain and an increased risk of type 2 diabetes. Eating fewer of these foods can help reduce risks and extend life.
5. Regular physical activity. Regular physical activity can help reduce the risk of death from any cause.
In short, following the Mediterranean Diet can help extend life by reducing the risk of developing chronic illnesses and by promoting a healthy lifestyle, including regular physical activity.

user_query: is gluten sensitivity real ?
text-davinci-003_response:
Yes, gluten sensitivity is real. This condition is sometimes referred to as Non-Celiac Gluten Sensitivity (NCGS), and it is estimated to affect 6-15% of the population.
Gluten sensitivity is similar to celiac disease in that consuming gluten can cause an immune reaction. However, unlike celiac disease, those affected by gluten sensitivity do not have any damage to their gut lining or an autoimmune response. Symptoms of gluten sensitivity can vary from person to person, and commonly include gastrointestinal discomfort (such as bloating and diarrhea), fatigue, headache, skin rash and brain fog.
Currently, there is no specific test to diagnose NCGS, so the diagnosis relies on ruling out other potential causes of these symptoms. Additionally, there is not a single accepted treatment for gluten sensitivity, although avoiding gluten is recommended.
In summary, gluten sensitivity is real and can affect people differently. It is important for those affected to discover their triggers and manage their symptoms effectively.

user_query: in making water alkaline , how much baking soda is too much ?

Baking soda is often used to raise the pH of water to make it more alkaline. However, too much baking soda can be too much of a good thing. The recommended dosage of baking soda to make water alkaline is a maximum of 1 teaspoon of baking soda for every 8–10 ounces of water. Consuming more than this amount can be unsafe, as ingested baking soda can cause sodium ion poisoning (hypernatremia).
